verses.verse: (The Eternal Dwelling of God in Zion) A Song of Ascents. [1] LORD, remember David And all his afflictions;
How he swore to the LORD, ((Ps. 130:7)) And vowed to (Ps. 65:1) the Mighty One of Jacob:
“Surely I will not go into the chamber of my house, Or go up to the comfort of my bed;
I will (Gen. 49:24; Is. 49:26; 60:16) not give sleep to my eyes Or slumber to my eyelids,
Until I (Prov. 6:4) find a place for the LORD, A dwelling place for the Mighty One of Jacob.”
Behold, we heard of it (1 Kin. 8:17; 1 Chr. 22:7; Ps. 26:8; Acts 7:46) in Ephrathah; (1 Sam. 17:12) We found it (1 Sam. 7:1) in the fields of the woods.
Let us go into His tabernacle; (1 Chr. 13:5) Let us worship at His footstool.
(Ps. 5:7; 99:5) Arise, O LORD, to Your resting place, You and (Num. 10:35) the ark of Your strength.
Let Your priests (Ps. 78:61) be clothed with righteousness, And let Your saints shout for joy.
For Your servant David’s sake, Do not turn away the face of Your Anointed.
(Job 29:14) The LORD has sworn in truth to David; He will not turn from it: “I will set upon your throne ((Ps. 89:3, 4, 33; 110:4)) the fruit of your body.
If your sons will keep My covenant And My testimony which I shall teach them, Their sons also shall sit upon your throne forevermore.”
(2 Sam. 7:12; (1 Kin. 8:25; 2 Chr. 6:16; Luke 1:69; Acts 2:30)) For the LORD has chosen Zion; He has desired it for His dwelling place:
“This ((Ps. 48:1, 2)) is My resting place forever; Here I will dwell, for I have desired it.
(Ps. 68:16; Matt. 23:21) I will abundantly bless her provision; I will satisfy her poor with bread.
(Ps. 147:14) I will also clothe her priests with salvation, (2 Chr. 6:41; Ps. 132:9; 149:4) And her saints shall shout aloud for joy.
(1 Sam. 4:5; Hos. 11:12) There I will make the horn of David grow; (Ezek. 29:21; Luke 1:69) I will prepare a lamp for My Anointed.
His enemies I will (1 Kin. 11:36; 15:4; 2 Kin. 8:19; 2 Chr. 21:7; Ps. 18:28) clothe with shame, But upon Himself His crown shall flourish.”
